result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean A Ellis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full-time employment, schooling or a combination of both.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process. 

Have no contact with anyone under the age of 18, unless otherwise approved by the agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Plea date on November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant opts in for text message reminders.

3:42 PM Defendant Sean A Ellis in court.  Attorney Ann M. Larson appeared by video for Sean A Ellis.  Attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives their right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial. 
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Plea date scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Amended Order for appointment of counsel is denied because the court finds Attorney Larson appointed through SPD office on 09-15-22.
Attorney Michael Blum is appointed as counsel of record.  Defendant is to reimburse the county at a rate of $25.00 per month commencing 11-01-22.
Ann Larson, public defender.
Petition for Appointment of an Attorney;  Affidavit of Indigency.

records.addlTxt:
4:43 pm - Defendant Sean A Ellis appeared by video, in custody, at Manitowoc County Jail.  Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Public defender has not appointed counsel yet.  Court finds good cause to toll the time limits.  The defendant wishes to proceed with the Court appointed attorney route.  He will be given the paperwork at the jail to complete and file.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Report from Public Defender indicating no attorney has been appointed yet.

ADDRESS INFO for Sean A Ellis
Current: 1129 S. 25th Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States  (Effective: 08-26-2022)
Prior: c/o Manitowoc County Jail, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States

$500.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.   
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail Bond. 
--Dale Eurich, 2000 Johnston Drive, Lot 77, Manitowoc, WI   54220.

Order Denying Motion to Modify Bail.
It is hereby ordered that the defendant's motion to modify bond is denied for the reasons stated on the record on 08-29-22.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 09-07-22 at 3:00 p.m.   Court addresses defendant's letter re: bond modification.   Court denies the motion. 
Minutes.

ADDRESS INFO for Sean A Ellis
Current: c/o Manitowoc County Jail, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States  (Effective: 08-26-2022)
Prior: 2000 Johnston Dr 77, Manitowoc, WI 54220
Victim Identification Key.
Re:  Felony bail jumping, on 08-20-22.
Letter from defendant
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of felony bail jumping.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 08-29-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $500.00 cash bond with the conditions that defendant is to have no contact with any person under the age of 18 and no contact with K.L.O., DOB: 03-15-2005.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff. 
Minutes.
